abstract: After months of speculation, Time Warner said that Jeffrey L. Bewkes, the chief operating officer, will succeed Richard D. Parsons as chief executive at the end of the year.
snippet: After months of speculation, Time Warner said that Jeffrey L. Bewkes, the chief operating officer, will succeed Richard D. Parsons as chief executive at the end of the year.
lead_paragraph: After months of speculation, Time Warner announced yesterday that Jeffrey L. Bewkes, the chief operating officer, will succeed Richard D. Parsons as chief executive at the end of the year.

headline.main: At Time Warner, Successor to Parsons Emerges
headline.print_headline: At Time Warner, Successor to Parsons Emerges

byline.original: By David Carr and Brian Stelter

abstract: The news that Jeffrey L. Bewkes, Time Warner‘s the chief operating officer, will succeed Richard D. Parsons as chief executive at the end of the year had industry watchers wondering if a spate of dealmaking may be in the offing at world’s largest media company.
lead_paragraph: The news that Jeffrey L. Bewkes, Time Warner‘s the chief operating officer, will succeed Richard D. Parsons as chief executive at the end of the year had industry watchers wondering if a spate of dealmaking may be in the offing at world’s largest media company.

headline.main: Time Warner May Be in for a New Era of Dealmaking
